triples.name: Data synchronization
triples.relevance: LSL proposes a software-based approach to data synchronization using timestamped streams over a common network.

triples.name: Neurophysiology
triples.relevance: LSL was built from the ground up for neurophysiological applications and multimodal neurobehavioral recording.

triples.name: Clock synchronization
triples.relevance: LSL implements time synchronization across networks to achieve millisecond-precise data recording.

triples.name: Local area network
triples.relevance: LSL synchronizes data streams across a common local area network (LAN) rather than using hardware solutions.

triples.name: Jitter
triples.relevance: LSL provides jitter compensation to account for network jitters and ensure continuous, millisecond-precise recording.

triples.name: Real-time computing
triples.relevance: LSL enables real-time analysis environments and brain-computer interface applications requiring deterministic timing.

triples.name: Brainâ€“computer interface
triples.relevance: LSL supports brain-computer interface applications as part of its neurobehavioral recording ecosystem.

triples.name: Electroencephalography
triples.relevance: LSL supports EEG and other neurophysiological recording instruments as major data acquisition device classes.

triples.name: Network Time Protocol
triples.relevance: LSL uses time synchronization concepts similar to NTP but tailored for local network synchronization with reduced latency.

triples.name: Python (programming language)
triples.relevance: LSL ecosystem supports Python as one of several programming languages for client software implementation.

triples.name: MATLAB
triples.relevance: LSL ecosystem supports MATLAB as one of several programming environments for neurophysiological analysis.

triples.name: Stimulus (physiology)
triples.relevance: LSL supports stimulus presentation tools and captures organismal dynamics in response to experimental stimuli.
